metadata.title: CVE-2016-10377 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Open vSwitch (OvS) 2.5.0, a malformed IP packet can cause the switch toread past the end of the packet buffer due to an unsigned integer underflowin `lib/flow.c` in the function `miniflow_extract`, permitting remotebypass of the access control list enforced by the switch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
openvswitch-ipsec - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
openvswitch-pki - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
openvswitch-switch - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
openvswitch-test - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
openvswitch-vtep - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ovn-central - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ovn-common - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
ovn-host - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-openvswitch - 2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
